[[CBC News]], March 20, 2007.</ref> was a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[poet]], [[translation|translator]] and [[academic]]. Dickson formerly worked as a professor for le Département d'études françaises et de traduction (Department of French Studies and Translation) at [[Laurentian University]] in [[Greater Sudbury|Sudbury]], [[Ontario]].<ref name=cbc /> He won the [[Governor General's Award]] for [[French language]] poetry in 2002, for his book ''Humains paysages en temps de paix relative'' ("Human Landscapes in Times of Relative Peace").<ref>[http://search.laurentian.ca/?file=newsrelease/2002/November/nov12_dickson_e.php "Robert Dickson wins the 2002 Governor General’s Literary Awards"]. Laurentian University, November 12, 2002.</ref> Dickson also wrote songs for the [[Franco-Ontarian]] [[folk rock]] group [[CANO]] in the 1970s.<ref name=cbc /> He also translated both French and English literary works, including English translations of works by [[Jean-Marc Dalpé]] and French translations of works by [[Tomson Highway]].<ref name=cbc /> Dickson died at his home in Sudbury on March 19, 2007 from [[brain cancer]].<ref name=cbc /> ==Quotation== <blockquote>"Si je peux poser quelques pierre blanches<br /> pour baliser le sentier à inventer,<br /> je ne serais que très content, <br /> croyant que j'ai ainsi fait quelque chose<br /> de valable avec ma vie." — Robert Dickson <ref>[http://www.radio-canada.ca/regions/Ontario/2007/03/19/008-deces-Dickson.shtml?ref=rss Radio-Canada: Robert Dickson n'est plus]</ref></blockquote> ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dickson, Robert | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = July 23, 1944 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = March 19, 2007 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dickson, Robert}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:2007 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from brain tumor]] [[Category:Canadian poets]] [[Category:Canadian songwriters]] [[Category:Canadian translators]] [[Category:Canadian writers in French]] [[Category:Franco-Ontarian people]] [[Category:Governor General's Award winning poets]] [[Category:Laurentian University faculty]] [[Category:Writers from Ontario]] [[Category:People from Greater Sudbury]] [[Category:French-language poets]] [[Category:Cancer deaths in Ontario]] {{Canada-poet-stub}}
